                                   double confidence,
                                   int timeHorizon)

        Parameters:
        portfolio - - this is the portfolio given by the user.
        confidence - - this is the confidence interval chosen by the user.
        timeHorizon - - this is the time horizon chosen by the user.

    • Method Detail

      • calculate

        public double calculate()
        This is the main method which performs the hands out work to the other methods to calculate the VaR.
        Specified by:
        calculate in interface Calculator
        Returns:
        - the value returned is the estimated value at risk. It is a double in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 where 1.0 is 100%.

      • matrixVariance

        public double matrixVariance(Portfolio pf)
        This method calculates the matrix variance. This is vital to be able to calculate the the standard deviation of the portfolio. It is a refined version of the proof of concept version.
        Parameters:
        pf - - this is the portfolio passed through in its current state, no changes will be made to it.
        Returns:
        the returned value is the variance of the portfolio, this is a way of measuring the spread of data.

      • matrixMult

        public double[][] matrixMult(double[][] m1,
                             double[][] m2)
        This method calculates the product of two matrices, in the order m1 * m2. Order is very important in matrix multiplication.
        Parameters:
        m1 - this is the first matrix in the multiplication.
        m2 - this is the second matrix in the multiplication.
        Returns:
        this is a matrix that is the product of m1*m2.

      • averageReturns

        public double averageReturns(Portfolio pf)
        This method works out the average over a whole portfolio.
        Parameters:
        pf - - this is the portfolio passed through. The method will not make any changes to it.
        Returns:
        the returned value is the average over the whole portfolio.

      • zcalc

        public static double zcalc(double confidence)
        This method calcualtes the Z score using the normal distribution curve.
        Parameters:
        confidence - - this is the confidence interval of the portfolio.
        Returns:
        the value returned will give us the Z score.

      • getPortfolio

        public Portfolio getPortfolio()
        This is a getter to be used for testing.
        Returns:
        the class portfolio is returned.
